stepTitle: Calculate the standard enthalpy change ΔH° at 25°C for the following reaction:\n\nCH₄ (g) + $$2$$ O₂ (g) → CO₂ (g) + $$2$$ H₂O (l)
stepBody:
Use the following standard molar enthalpies of formation, ΔH_f°, at 25°C:
ΔH_f° CH₄ (g) $$=$$ $$-74.81$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
ΔH_f° O₂ (g) $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
ΔH_f° CO₂ (g) $$=$$ $$-393.5$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
ΔH_f° H₂O (l) $$=$$ $$-285.83$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$

Compute the standard enthalpy change ΔH° in kJ to two decimal places. Be sure to account for the stoichiometric coefficients in the balanced equation.
